data.description:
## Problem
Sprint IDs use inconsistent formats:
- S-NNN (e.g., S-026) - Sequential number
- S-sprint-NNN-name (e.g., S-sprint-017-spark-slm) - Legacy format
- S-YYYY-MM (e.g., S-2025-12) - Date-based (from generate_sprint_id())

This inconsistency:
- Makes sorting/filtering harder
- Complicates ID parsing
- Creates confusion about which format to use

## Current State (Production Data)
```
S-018, S-019, S-020, S-021, S-022, S-023, S-024, S-025, S-026  # Sequential
S-sprint-001 through S-sprint-020-*  # Legacy format
```

## Solution
1. Standardize on S-NNN format for new sprints
2. Update generate_sprint_id() to use sequential format:
```python
def generate_sprint_id(number: int) -> str:
    return f"S-{number:03d}"
```

3. Document legacy format as deprecated but supported
4. Add migration guide for renaming if desired (optional)

## Files
- cortical/utils/id_generation.py:generate_sprint_id()
- scripts/got_utils.py (sprint create command)

## Acceptance Criteria
1. New sprints use S-NNN format consistently
2. Legacy formats still parse correctly
3. Documentation clarifies preferred format
4. No breaking changes to existing sprint references
data.title: Consolidate Sprint ID format for consistency
